channel.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
channel.description:
I was told that RegeX had tipped of jagex that all the aryan users would log in with 2 packets less that the usal client would; So then Jagex recorded all the accounts that logged in with less packets and then did the 5000+ account bannings; Then he had changed it back to normal in the next revision
Is this true?

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Ahahaha I remember the "“This account has been banned.” thing, there were 100’s of threads going “OMG!!?!!??! LEIK WAT R I BAND 4?”

Good stuff Pd/kamu

Read full topic
item.source: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

Mopman:

OK, let’s say it was pd (I don’t know who really did it) - do you really think Regex/Exemplar/Sean didn’t know about it and it was somehow behind their back? Lol, I think you overestimate how much they actually gave a fuck about Aryan.

I can’t believe this topic is still alive. I feel like I’ve confessed to this 20 times, yet it always goes back to Regex.

Regex had nothing to do with it – he’d been on vacation for two weeks, which meant that the rest of us couldn’t use him as we typically did: the buffer between us and the 8,000 kids who harrassed you 2 minutes after an update to “hury up fkr wen is ryan gon 2 wrk agn lolol??? wtf iz tekkin so fkn long u guyz r lzrs”.

That is annoying. Kamu also found it annoying.

No one remembers the update just before the -uid, where Kamu changed the “Please reload, Runescape has been updated” message to “This account has been banned.” That was also very funny.

But eventually they figured that out.

So we decided to make it real. I committed a real update, but with all UIDs being negative. Then I emailed Jagex with the diff, just to make sure they wouldn’t overlook it.

Next week: 50,000 people banned, and lots of me peeing my pants with laughter.

All because they couldn’t wait an extra 8 hours before running their 30 bots on daddy’s computer.

Moral of the story: don’t annoy the people who are already wasting far more time on you than they ever should, solely because you “rly nd mor milz”.

Read full topic
item.source: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

It was Pd and Kamu.

Mopman:

OK, let’s say it was pd (I don’t know who really did it) - do you really think Regex/Exemplar/Sean didn’t know about it and it was somehow behind their back? Lol, I think you overestimate how much they actually gave a fuck about Aryan.

They didn’'t give a fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @jusano jusano
item.description:
@jusano wrote:

LMFAO Regecks it was you.

I was around runescape but I never knew about the whole cheating community, but I did hear about Aryan. I knew these people were gonna get banned, and I never thought it would cause a massacre of n00bs. :]

Thanks for making my day.

I wonder how your emotion was like.

Imagines*

Regeks:

HAHAHAHA NOOBS GOT PWNED. YAYYYYYYY NO MO’ LEACHERS XD

=D

Read full topic

Yeh i used to use ARYAN2.
never used it on my main but tham i had lotsa bots online
and i did not leech the program btw.
i was a legit ARYAN user…

but yeh all my purer got banned
But i was prepared fro that and evry time i putted the bots offline i traded al the yews the cutted,flax the plicked fish they fished and yeh me is still rich now

and becouse there 3 New bots out (not that new just finnaly working fine)
there’s like 2 new ARYANs now but in priv sections so leechers wont get the prog thats easy and if not mutch ppl get the prog it wont be that detecteble

Greetz : joery

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

moparisthebest:

No, that is not true, I believe it is true however that pd and/or sean changed aryan to send a negative uid to jagex, which could never be produced by jagex’s code (math.random()) that is how aryan got “trapped” and jagex banned people that way

I agree with Mopar, I’m 100% sure RegeX didn’t tip off Jagex.

Read full topic

item.title: Did RegeX tip off jagex to mass ban 5000 accounts? look
item.dc:creator: @pko pko
item.description:
@pko wrote:

He was the one the DID it, but one of the members of the aryan dev team (Kamu) got the idea. What they did was send a false packet with a negative UID, which made the accounts that had a negative UID banned, which were all the aryan users that used it while it was going on.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Coca_Cola Coca Cola
item.description:
@Coca_Cola wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:10, topic:4179”]Made me laugh because I was using Sbot3 by then lol.

I believe thats when Jagex said they had new macro detection aswell, the things they tell the legit players to keep them happy lol.[/quote]

Yeah. It’s funny how they call this macro detection. It’s just searching and finding small differences between the clients used.

I myself have started work on a bot named Amethyst - I’m not the greatest Java programmer though so it’s progressing rather slowly.

~Cola
